simplesocial

Enum Operation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Operation>
      • simplesocial.Operation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<Operation>

    public enum Operation
extends Enum<Operation>
    This enum helps identify an operation. It is used mainly as a message from a SimpleSocial client to the server.
    Author:
    Francesco Landolfi

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static Operation[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Operation c : Operation.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static Operation valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • toInt

        public int toInt()
        Converts the Operation to an Integer.

        The resulting value can be translated back to Operation using the method getOperationFromInt(int).

        Returns:
        the integer corresponding to the Operation

      • getOperationFromInt

        public static Operation getOperationFromInt(int op)
        Converts an Integer to its corresponding Operation.

        Note: this methods accepts values from 0 to 7. Other values will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        op - the Integer to be converted
        Returns:
        the resulting Operation
